diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis, Bacteremia, due to contaminant
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute cholecystitis was supported by the patient's symptoms of sharp, constant right-sided abdominal pain, elevated lactate levels, and imaging studies showing extrahepatic biliary duct dilation and gallstones. Bacteremia was indicated through blood cultures, which noted the presence of coagulase negative Staphylococcus as a contaminant.
